title: Use Aviator in Agent Interface
content:
Chat with Aviator

You can chat with Aviator by clicking the Aviator icon in Agent Interface. 

Aviator disclaimer acceptance

An Aviator disclaimer popup will appear upon your first interaction with Aviator, prompting for user acceptance. To engage in conversations with Aviator, click I understand.

Ask a question

  1. Type your question (for example, how to connect to a printer) in the message bar and click the Post icon . Then, Aviator will generate an answer to your question.
  2. If the answer isn't complete, click Continue generating to view the full text. 
  3. For any follow-up questions, type them in the message bar and click the Post icon . More detailed questions will result in more accurate responses. If there's no reference resource found in the previous question, Aviator may search and provide reference resources in the follow-up question.
  4. Click the References icon to view the detailed information about the reference materials relevant to your question. See Use Aviator in Service Portal for more information about the References section.

Summarize a record

When you select or open a record (with all OOB and custom application record types which can be searched out by IDOL, such as incident, request, change, problem, … and those record types defined in custom applications) from a grid page, a “New topic” hint message and the ticket number is displayed in the chat window. 

  • You can click the ticket number to view the details of this record. 
  • You can click the Summarize this record option to ask Aviator to summarize the current ticket information. You can ask follow-up questions after Aviator provides the summary. 
  • If you want to end the conversation for the summary, you can click the Start new topic icon and ask another question. 
 
This feature is only available on the record types that support IDOL based search. For the record types that don't support IDOL based search, such as tasks and approvals, the Summarize this record option won't be displayed. 

Summarize ticket / Suggest a solution for Request and Incident

When you open a request or incident record, or open an existing request in Live Support, a dividing line and the ticket number is displayed in the chat window. 

  • You can click the ticket number to view the details of this record.
  • You can click the Summarize this request or Summarize this incident option to ask Aviator to summarize the current request or incident information. You can ask follow-up questions after Aviator provides the summary.
  • You can click the Suggest a solution option to ask Aviator to provide suggested solution for the current request or incident. You can ask follow-up questions after Aviator provides the solution.
  • If you want to end the conversation for the summary or solution, you can click the Start new topic icon and ask another question.

Create a new topic

If you want to change a topic in the current conversation, click the Start new topic icon  in front of the message bar. A "New topic" hint message is displayed in the screen to divide the different topics.

Manage conversations

When you need to chat across multiple topics/conversations, you may use the Start new conversation and  Conversation history options to create and switch between different conversations.

Start new conversation

You can click the  Start new conversation icon to save the current conversation and create a new conversation. 
Each user can create 20 conversations at most.

View conversation history

You can click the  Conversation history icon to view the conversation list. You may select the conversation name to switch between different conversations.

  • To rename a conversation, click "..." next to the conversation name and then click Rename.
  • To delete a conversation, click "..." next to the conversation name and then click Delete.
  • To sort the conversations by last update time from oldest to newest or from newest to oldest, click  or on the top left corner.

Other action icons

 : You can click the copy icon to copy the bot response to your clipboard.

  and    : You can move the chat window by dragging the title bar. Also, you can move the chat window to the right-most edge or left-most edge using these two icons.

 : Refresh the current chat screen. For example, when you open multiple browsers or tabs, after you chat with Aviator in one browser, if you switch to another browser or tab, you need to refresh the chat window to get the latest response to continue the same conversation. 

 : Close the chat window. You may re-open the chat window by clicking the Aviator icon.

Analyze the sentiment of Requests

Aviator automatically analyzes the sentiment expressed by end users in Requests and categorizes it as "positive", "neutral", or "negative". The result is displayed in the Sentiment analysis field in the Classification section of the Request. If the sentiment is "negative", a business rule assigns the Request to your chosen Service Desk group, ensuring that such Requests are responded to quickly.

Generate and send escalation notifications for Requests

When a Request is escalated due to negative sentiment, Aviator automatically generates an email (based on the negative portion of the request) to the requester that addresses the concerns expressed and provides assurance that the issue is being looked into. A business rule then sends the email to the requester.

Analyze the risk of Changes

An Analyze risk button in the Change form enables Change coordinators to quickly generate a descriptive risk assessment and numerical risk score for the Change. The results are displayed in the AI risk assessment and AI risk score fields.

The risk is scored as follows:

  • 0: There is no risk 
  • 1: The risk is low 
  • 2: The risk is moderate 
  • 3: The risk is high 
  • 4: The risk is very high 

Create Knowledge articles  

When the Knowledge candidate option in an Incident is selected, Aviator automatically generates a draft knowledge article title and text based on information in the Incident. This draft is saved to a new Article record that is linked to the Incident. 

Resolve Incidents

When analyzing an Incident, agents can click the Resolve button in the main menu, and Aviator will propose a solution based on information in the Incident. This solution is saved in the Solution field of the Incident.

Privacy analysis for Requests

Aviator can automatically analyze whether Requests contain private information, including personally identifiable information (such as names and contact details), financial information (such as credit card numbers and bank account details), health information (such as medical records and health insurance information), and other sensitive information (such as authentication credentials and confidential business information). If the Request contains private information, "Private" is displayed in the Privacy field of the Request record together with a short justification, and the Request is automatically assigned to the "HR Private Sensitive" group. Otherwise, "Neutral" is displayed in the Privacy field of the Request record.

View records updated by Aviator business rules

To empower service workflow automation, your tenant admin might have configured Aviator business rules for certain record types so that Aviator can leverage these record data when generating text.

To verify if a specific record is automatically updated by Aviator, go to the History tab of this record and check if the Updated by column shows Aviator. Use your judgment when viewing records updated by Aviator.
